channel.title: Posts on spencerjp.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on spencerjp.dev

item.title: Effective systemd: Where Are My Backups?
item.description: Backups are important. Good backups are tested long before the disaster they are meant to recover from. With this in mind, I checked my backups today: $ sudo tarsnap --list-archives | sort [sudo] password for spencer: localhost-2020-08-02_15-25-38 localhost-2020-11-02_00-00-06 Hold on - there should be five of them since August, and I only see two. My laptop isn’t always on, which is why I set up my backup system on a systemd timer.

item.title: Hello, World
item.description: #include <stdio.h> int main(int argc, char *argv[]) { printf("Hello, world!"); } Oh no, another gravestone of the modern web: some developer’s personal blog.
